title: Aluminum Industry Mulls Unveiled CBAM Benchmarks, Default Values
summary: Aluminum producers are reviewing the preliminary benchmarks and default values for the Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism (CBAM), which could impact trade and pricing in the sector. The industry is assessing how these new standards will affect competitiveness and compliance.

title: SMM Flash News: Secondary Aluminum Ingot Social Inventory Falls on Nov 21
summary: Social inventory of secondary aluminum ingots declined on November 21, according to SMM statistics. The market saw a slight recovery in aluminum prices, with ADC12 alloy prices stabilizing at 21,450 yuan/mt.

title: Monster faces modest tariff impact from aluminum costs
summary: Monster Beverage expects a modest impact from tariffs in the current quarter and next year, primarily due to high duties on imported aluminum for cans. The Midwest premium for aluminum surged to a record high in November, driven by the 50% Section 232 import tariff imposed by the Trump administration. The company raised prices effective November 1, though the increases were focused on revenue growth rather than being directly tariff-related.

title: A second fire breaks out at Ford's aluminum supplier Novelis
summary: A second fire broke out at Novelis' Oswego aluminum plant, which supplies Ford's F-150 truck range. Bank of America noted that aluminum prices are unlikely to return to current levels until early next decade, with forecasts expecting prices to trade between $2,900-3,400 from 2030-2035. The facility had been targeting December for production restart despite earlier disruptions.

title: Third Fire Hits Ford's Key Aluminum Supplier, Threatening $2B Recovery
summary: A third fire in three months erupted at the Novelis aluminum plant in Oswego, NY, threatening to derail Ford's recovery from supply chain disruptions that have already cost the automaker $2 billion. The four-alarm blaze broke out Thursday morning at the facility that supplies critical aluminum sheets for Ford's F-150 trucks, including the all-electric Lightning. The fire forced a complete evacuation, with all workers safely evacuated and the fire brought under control.

title: Aluminum plant supplying Ford pickups erupts in fire again
summary: Heavy black plumes of smoke were visible coming from the roof of the Novelis plant, with the fire originating from the plant's cold mill. Ford was working with Novelis to restart the plant as early as the following week, with CFO Sherry House telling investors that efforts to resume work were on track with expectations for restart around Thanksgiving or early December. Novelis declined to discuss whether the latest fire would affect its production restart plans.

title: Inert Anode Aluminum Production: Carbon-Free Future
summary: Global aluminum production generates approximately 1.1 billion tonnes of CO₂ equivalent emissions annually. Inert anode technology could eliminate 400-500 million tonnes of direct process emissions if it achieves 50% market penetration by 2040, while also offering productivity enhancements up to 5% above conventional methods and enabling higher-purity aluminum grades.

title: Sortera Scales Solution to the Mixed Aluminum Problem with $45 Million in Funding and New Tennessee Facility
summary: Sortera Technologies, an AI-powered recycling company, is opening a second facility in Tennessee to scale its mixed aluminum sorting technology. The company's proprietary system reduces energy requirements for aluminum production by approximately 95% compared to virgin material manufacturing, diverting billions of pounds of material from overseas shipment.

title: Across the Aluminum Value Chain: How Collaboration Drives Decarbonization
summary: ELYSIS, a joint venture between Alcoa and Rio Tinto, achieved a major milestone by successfully starting up its 450 kiloampere inert anode cell at a Rio Tinto smelter in Quebec. The breakthrough technology replaces carbon anodes with inert material that emits oxygen instead of CO₂, producing aluminum with approximately 40% lower carbon footprint than conventional low-carbon primary aluminum.

title: Ball, Unilever show green aluminium can work
summary: Ball Corporation and Unilever have produced the first consumer goods packaging using ELYSIS carbon-free aluminum technology in aerosol cans. The product combines 50% ELYSIS aluminum with 50% post-consumer recycled content, demonstrating how innovation at the material level can deliver tangible sustainability benefits.

title: Investing In Innovation: GBCCA Showcases New Technology To Close the Recycling Loop for Aluminium Cans
summary: The Global Beverage Can Circularity Alliance showcased breakthrough innovations including robotics, AI, and deposit return systems aimed at achieving 80% global aluminum can recycling rates by 2030 and 100% by 2050. Advanced technologies enable autonomous sorting and recovery of aluminum cans from municipal waste, unlocking immense volumes of valuable material.

title: HRC Steel Price Update and Market Outlook
summary: Hot-Rolled Coil (HRC) Steel prices rose slightly to 856 USD/T on November 20, 2025, up 0.12% from the previous day. Over the past month, prices increased by 4.81%, and are up 22.60% compared to the same time last year. Analysts expect HRC Steel to trade at 865.36 USD/T by the end of the quarter and forecast a rise to 938.96 USD/T within 12 months.

title: Steel Prices in November 2025: Market Dynamics, Price Drivers, and Industry Outlook
summary: US steel prices have surged in November 2025, with the benchmark price for hot rolled coil reaching $910 per ton, driven by consecutive mill price hikes and extended lead times into January. The video discusses the underlying market forces contributing to this rally amid a manufacturing slowdown.

title: Latest Update in the SMM Finished Steel Market
summary: Steel mills showed limited inquiries and procured at lower prices amid subdued market sentiment. Stainless steel futures continued to decline, with spot prices weakening and sluggish transactions prevailing in the year-end off-season market. A major stainless steel mill set purchase prices for high-grade NPI and high-carbon ferrochrome, reflecting cautious market conditions.

title: Price gap between US HRC and imports narrows
summary: The price gap between US hot rolled coil steel and landed offshore products narrowed week over week. The market shows signs of an imminent demand spike in Q1, with steelmaking raw material prices stabilizing through November. Industry leaders express optimism about the current US steel market conditions.

title: 2025-2026 Steel Price Forecast
summary: US steel prices have stabilized in the low to mid $800s per short ton during summer 2025, with futures trending upward through spring 2026. The 50% steel tariff effective June 2025 and pent-up demand are expected to keep prices range-bound to modestly firmer, with potential price increases in 2026 due to seasonal demand and supply constraints.

title: American steel producers are gradually raising prices for rolled products
summary: American steel producers, including Nucor Bar Group, are increasing prices for rolled steel products. Nucor raised the cost of all types of rebar by $30 per short ton for new orders received after November 7, reflecting ongoing price adjustments in the US steel market.

title: Barry Zekelman says it's a 'fantastic' time for steel in the US
summary: Barry Zekelman expressed optimism about the US steel market, noting strong volumes and positive conditions driven by data center demand and infrastructure needs. He highlighted that hot rolled prices are on the upswing and emphasized the massive amount of steel being used in data center construction and related infrastructure. However, he acknowledged challenges in Canada's steel industry, which he described as being significantly impacted by China's global steel displacement.

title: Steel Rebounds to Highest in November
summary: Steel rebar futures in China climbed to CNY 3,090 per tonne, the highest since the beginning of November, reflecting Beijing's anti-involution policy aimed at reducing supply. Crude steel output in China fell 12% annually in October, marking the lowest output for the month since 2021, while steel exports declined 12.5% year-over-year. Construction demand remained under pressure with the official construction PMI falling to a record low in October.

title: Column: China steel output slumps as iron ore imports head for record
summary: China's steel output reached 72.0 million tons in October, down 12.1% from the same month in 2024, with annual production on track to fall below 1 billion tons for the first time since 2019. Despite the production decline, iron ore imports are heading toward a record high, exceeding 2024's record of 1.24 billion tons. Mills are struggling with higher input costs and muted demand from the construction sector.

title: Good news in Gary and Pittsburgh — but still America declines
summary: The Gary Works steel mill, located thirty miles south of Chicago, is receiving a $14 billion modernization that will protect tens of thousands of jobs. This investment represents positive developments for major US steel production centers despite broader industry challenges.

title: American steel producers are gradually raising prices for rolled products
summary: Nucor and Gerdau have announced adjustments to their hot-rolled coil offers and rebar pricing, reflecting market dynamics in the American steel sector.

title: Steel sector needs more investment in R&D, use of AI for overall growth
summary: A central government minister emphasized that India's steel sector requires increased investment in research and development and wider adoption of technologies such as artificial intelligence, machine learning, digitalization and modern mining methods to enhance competitiveness and operational efficiency. Speaking at a two-day policy retreat in Odisha, authorities highlighted steel's role as the backbone of national infrastructure and stressed collaboration between central public sector enterprises and private entities.

title: Stavian Industrial Metal Unveils Green Strategy at VIMOX 2025 as Platinum Sponsor, Positioning Vietnam as Global Metals Hub
summary: Stavian Industrial Metal announced a comprehensive green strategy focused on sustainable metal production and trading partnerships. The company signed a binding agreement with India's ACME Group to distribute and off-take 800,000 tons per year of green hot briquetted iron (HBI) and direct reduced iron (DRI) for the Asian market for at least 10 years, aligning with Vietnam's Net Zero 2050 agenda.

title: Copper - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News - Trading Economics
summary: Copper prices fell to 4.92 USD/lb on November 21, 2025, down 0.63% from the previous day. The price has declined 0.79% over the past month but remains 20.73% higher than the same time last year. Market sentiment has been affected by uncertainty over Federal Reserve rate cuts, reducing expectations for a December cut.

title: Copper price falls on Fed uncertainty, Codelco supply relief
summary: Copper prices dropped as much as 2.4% due to uncertainty over US monetary policy and eased supply concerns following Codelco's announcement of increased output. The dollar strengthened, adding pressure on metals, while demand remains subdued despite earlier supply disruptions.

title: Copper prices rise after Nvidia's results, but the dollar is still strong
summary: Copper prices saw a modest rise after Nvidia's results, with LME copper trading around $10,738.50 per ton. Goldman Sachs raised its copper price forecast for December 2025 and remains bullish on copper through 2026-2027, citing demand growth and resource constraints.

title: Copper demand set to soar amid supply crunch
summary: Copper demand is expected to surge due to global electrification, electric vehicles, renewables, and grid upgrades, while supply constraints persist across mining, refining, and smelting. Analysts warn that new supply additions and recycling will not be enough to close the widening supply-demand gap by 2035.

title: Widening Supply-Demand Gap to Drive Copper Prices to New Heights
summary: Global copper mine output dropped 4.7% year-on-year in Q3 2025 due to disruptions in major producing regions, including Peru, DRC, and Indonesia. The supply-demand gap is projected to widen to 300,000 tons in 2026, supporting expectations for copper prices to reach new highs.

title: Cobre Panama Mine Reopening Timeline and Global Supply Impact
summary: The Cobre Panama mine remains closed, removing about 3% of global primary copper supply. Market analysts expect a potential restart in late 2026, with significant stockpiled ore and concentrate available for processing once operations resume.

title: Cochilco hikes 2025-2026 copper price forecasts to record highs
summary: Chile’s Cochilco raised its copper price forecasts for 2025 and 2026 to record levels due to weak production and ongoing supply constraints. Chilean copper output is expected to grow only slightly in 2025, with modest increases projected for 2026 and beyond.

title: Dyno Nobel: setting a new standard for safer, smarter blasting
summary: Dyno Nobel announced new precision blasting technology that enables mining companies to extract copper, iron ore, and gold more efficiently and sustainably. The company developed an electric MPU (Mobile Processing Unit) that can be fully charged in 45 minutes using renewable energy and significantly reduces explosive waste by delivering precise amounts for each blast hole.

title: Canada One CEO to Present at 2025 MiningTech North America Conference
summary: Canada One Mining Corp.'s CEO will participate in an opening panel discussion on shaping the future of mining, covering investment, technology, AI, decarbonization, and energy transfer. The company is advancing its Copper Dome Project in British Columbia, a porphyry copper-gold system focused on powering the global energy transition.

title: Stavian Industrial Metal Unveils Green Strategy at VIMOX 2025
summary: Stavian Industrial Metal presented its green strategy at VIMOX 2025 in Vietnam, positioning the country as a global metals hub. The company signed a binding agreement with India's ACME Group to distribute 800,000 tons per year of green hot briquetted iron and direct reduced iron for the Asian market for at least 10 years.

title: SMM #1 Refined Nickel Price Update
summary: On November 21, the SMM #1 refined nickel price was 114,400-119,000 yuan/mt, with an average price of 116,700 yuan/mt. This represents a decline of 1,500 yuan/mt from the previous trading session, marking nickel prices breaking below the 118,000–123,000 yuan/mt range that had persisted for nearly four months.

title: Nickel price hits 4-year low as gloom offsets potential Indonesia cuts
summary: Nickel fell 1.8% to $15,235 a ton on the London Metal Exchange, hitting a four-year low as a lackluster outlook from the Federal Reserve for 2025 outweighed the possibility of sharp mining cuts in Indonesia. Indonesia is considering deep cuts to nickel mining quotas, potentially lowering the amount of nickel ore allowed to be mined next year to 150 million tons from 272 million tons this year.

title: FLASH: Indonesia releases benchmark prices for nickel ore in November period I
summary: The Indonesia Nickel Miners Association (APNI) announced benchmark prices for nickel ore for the first half of November 2025, with the reference price set at $15,075.33/wmt, dropping 0.44% from October's second period. FOB prices across all nickel grades declined, with Ni 1.6% at $26.65/wmt and Ni 2.0% at $41.16/wmt.

title: Nickel Falls to 7-Month Low
summary: Nickel futures in the UK sank to $14,550 per tonne in November, marking the lowest level since the four-year low of $13,900 touched in April. The decline is attributed to mounting oversupply, with output remaining ample amid the over-expansion of Indonesia's nickel sector since the country blocked ore exports in 2020.

title: Nornickel maintains 2025 nickel production forecast
summary: Russia's Nornickel maintained its nickel production outlook for 2025 at 196,000-204,000 metric tons, with Q3 production rising 18% to 54,000 metric tons. The company attributed production declines in the first nine months to the need to replace Western mining equipment as part of its import substitution program.

title: Nickel investors on edge as Indonesia tightens the screws on smelters
summary: Indonesia has introduced stricter rules requiring applicants for refinery permits to stop producing intermediate nickel products, creating uncertainty for companies navigating a weak price cycle and supply glut. The new regulation threatens multibillion-dollar investments tied to the world's largest nickel reserves.

title: Tartisan Nickel Corp. Engages Rodren Drilling Ltd. for Drill Program at the Kenbridge Nickel-Copper-Cobalt Deposit
summary: Tartisan Nickel Corp. has retained Rodren Drilling Ltd. to conduct a 3,600-meter diamond drilling program at its Kenbridge deposit in Northwestern Ontario. The Phase 1 program is designed to convert Inferred resources into Measured and Indicated categories with mobilization scheduled for December 2025.

title: Alaska, Montana projects added to FAST-41
summary: Alaska Energy Metals' Nickolai nickel project and US Critical Materials' Sheep Creek gallium-rare earths project have been added to the FAST-41 dashboard. This designation aims to expedite permitting for critical mineral projects.

title: Twin Metals seeking state mineral leases Boundary Waters?
summary: Franconia Minerals, a subsidiary of Twin Metals, is requesting new mineral leases from Minnesota to explore for copper-nickel near Birch Lake. The company proposes drilling up to 19 test holes centered around Bob Bay, with work to be completed by March 31, 2027 if approved.

title: Alaska, Montana projects added to FAST-41
summary: Alaska Energy Metals' Nickolai nickel project and US Critical Materials' Sheep Creek gallium-rare earths projects have been added to the FAST-41 dashboard. This represents progress in developing North American critical mineral infrastructure.

title: Indonesia Nickel Market Dominance: Supply Chain Control
summary: Indonesia's nickel market dominance is transforming global supply chains and driving innovation in battery technology, including accelerated research into nickel-free batteries, recycling technologies, and alternative chemistry scaling like LFP batteries. Supply chain concentration risk is spurring investment in alternative technologies and substitution materials.

title: First Atlantic Nickel Attends Benchmark Week 2025 Conference
summary: First Atlantic Nickel showcased its Pipestone XL awaruite project at Benchmark Week 2025, promoting a smelter-free source of nickel and cobalt for North America's critical mineral needs. Awaruite is a naturally magnetic nickel-cobalt alloy that offers an alternative processing approach.

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali finalises a 200 million euro share capital increase and the acquisition of Special Melted Products in UK
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali completed a 200 million euro share capital increase to support growth and acquisitions, including the acquisition of Special Melted Products in the UK. This move is part of the company's strategy to expand its industrial footprint and capabilities.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali: 94% of the energy used comes from renewable sources and 93% of employees have permanent contracts
summary: On World Environment Day 2025, Cogne Acciai Speciali released its first Group Sustainability Report highlighting that over 94% of the electricity used by the Group comes from renewable sources. The company emphasizes sustainability as a core part of its corporate strategy and long-term value creation.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Salzgitter AG sells Mannesmann Stainless Tubes Group to Cogne Acciai Speciali
summary: Salzgitter AG sold the Mannesmann Stainless Tubes Group to Cogne Acciai Speciali for €135 million. This acquisition aligns with Salzgitter's portfolio management strategy and provides MST and its employees with new entrepreneurial opportunities under Cogne's ownership.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Greenland grants 30-year permit to EU-backed Molybdenum mine
summary: Greenland Resources signed off-take agreements with Finland's Outokumpu and Italy's Cogne Acciai Speciali for the Malmbjerg molybdenum project. The project is supported by the European Raw Materials Alliance and represents a step forward for Greenland's economic autonomy.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Italy's Tenaris posts surprise 2% rise in sales on stable US, Canada drilling
summary: Italian steel pipe maker Tenaris reported a 2% increase in third-quarter net sales to $2.98 billion, driven by stable drilling activity in North America, offsetting weakness in other regions. Despite the sales rise, the company warned that margins would be affected by the full impact of tariff costs, with EU steel producers operating at reduced capacity due to rising imports and tariffs.

title: Tenaris 2024 Annual Report: Industrial leadership, sustainability and community impact
summary: Tenaris released its 2024 Annual Report highlighting investments in industrial excellence, sustainability, and innovation, including modernization of its Dalmine steel mill in Italy. The company is advancing towards reducing CO2 intensity by 30% by 2030 and has integrated new operations to enhance reporting transparency.

title: Tenaris hosts panel on nuclear energy and Italy's boilermaking future
summary: Tenaris hosted a panel in Italy discussing the strategic role of nuclear energy in Europe's energy transition and Italy's potential to strengthen its boilermaking industry. The company’s Italian mill obtained ASME III certification to supply materials for nuclear facilities, emphasizing quality, traceability, and compliance with international standards.

title: Tenaris in Italy achieves ASME certification for the supply of materials for the nuclear sector
summary: Tenaris’s Dalmine mill in Italy completed the qualification process to supply certified materials for nuclear facilities according to the ASME III standard. This certification is crucial for supplying products internationally for new nuclear plants and maintenance, supporting the global energy transition towards low-carbon sources.

title: Tenaris to launch TenarisShawcor White Jacket™ coating at the Hydrogen and CCUS Technology World Expo
summary: Tenaris announced the launch of an advanced coating system developed at its Villamarzana, Italy facility, suitable for hydrogen and carbon capture pipelines. This innovation enhances resistance to material embrittlement and mechanical protection, reinforcing Tenaris’s position in supplying integrated solutions for challenging pipeline projects.

title: Tenaris to supply OCTG, line pipe and coatings for Suriname's first offshore development
summary: Tenaris secured a contract to supply casing, tubing, and coatings for TotalEnergies’ GranMorgu offshore project, with production and coating operations taking place at its Italian and Mexican facilities. The contract includes advanced technologies and integrated services to support efficient offshore operations.

title: Italian expertise fuels Prysmian innovation
summary: Prysmian continues to invest heavily in R&D in Italy, focusing on submarine energy cables and advanced interconnection solutions for renewable energy. The company's Milan-based R&D hub is central to its global innovation strategy, supported by Italian authorities and regional funding. Prysmian has also been appointed to the Green New Deal-funded projects for 2025-2028 in the field of submarine energy cables.

title: Prysmian further extends its leadership in optical fibre innovation with world’s first 160 micron bend insensitive fibre
summary: Prysmian has launched the world’s first 160 micron bend insensitive fibre, setting a new benchmark in network miniaturization. This innovation highlights Prysmian’s ongoing commitment to advancing cable technology in Italy and globally.

title: Prysmian Raises Annual Targets After Record Q3 Performance
date: Not specified (recently published, within past 24 hours context)
summary: Prysmian has raised its full-year 2025 guidance following a record-breaking third quarter. The company’s strong financial performance reflects its leadership in the cable industry, including copper cables, and its strategic focus on innovation and growth in Italy.
